title: Brihadaranyaka Upanishad
summary: The Brihadaranyaka Upanishad (Sanskrit: बृहदारण्यक उपनिषद्, Br̥hadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad)  is one of the Principal Upanishads and one of the first Upanishadic scriptures of Hinduism.[4] A key scripture to various schools of Hinduism, the Brihadaranyaka Upanisad is tenth in the Muktikā or "canon of 108 Upanishads".[5]
